featured.text: Requirements for a 14-day non-visa entry are: passport good for at least six months, confirmed onward ticket within 14 days, no violation of law recorded.

If it is necessary to stay more than 14 days and less than 30 days, nationals of the specific countries holding a 14-day non-visa entry should in the meantime apply for a landing-visa with the authorized office in the CKS airport from the Bureau of Consular Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

As of May 1, 1995, all nationals of the following 15 countries are exempted from securing visas for entry into the Republic of China: U.S.A., Japan, Canada, Belgium, Luxembourg, Sweden, Holland, New Zealand, Australia, Austria, Germany, Britain, France, Spain, and Portugal.
He should obtain a visa for entry into the Republic of China before getting on board the flight to Taiwan (B)
He just needs to apply for a non-visa entry when he arrives at the CKS airport.

definition.zh_def: 進入、登錄或參加的行為或過程。
definition.en_def: The act or process of entering, registering, or participating.
definition.example: Please submit your entry for the art competition by the end of the week.
